utils module¶

Contains the methods used by the solving algorithms.

utils.condition_C1(ambiguous_transitions)[source]¶

Checks if condition C1 is satisfied.

Condition C1 is satisfied if the set of ambiguous transitions is empty.

Parameters:ambiguous_transitions (set(tuple(str, str))) – set of ambiguous transitions
Returns:whether condition C1 is satisfied or not
Return type:bool
utils.condition_C2(bad_twin)[source]¶

Checks if condition C2 is satisfied.

Condition C2 is satisfied if the bad twin is not non-deterministic.

Parameters:bad_twin (Automaton) – the current level bad twin
Returns:whether condition C2 is satisfied or not
Return type:bool
utils.condition_C3(bad_twin)[source]¶

Checks if condition C3 is satisfied.

Condition C3 is satisfied if the bad twin has no events associated both to a fault transition and to an observable one.

Parameters:bad_twin (Automaton) – the current level bad twin
Returns:whether condition C3 is satisfied or not
Return type:bool
utils.find(src, n, fault, event)[source]¶

Finds the triplets according to the provided pseudocode.

Parameters:
  • src (State) – the starting state
  • n (int) – the target level
  • fault (bool) – a flag indicating whether the transition is fault or not
  • event (Event) – the composed n-level event to be associated to the transition
Returns:

the triplets according to the provided pseudocode
Return type:

list(tuple(Event, State, bool))
utils.find_loops(src, visited)[source]¶

Checks if there is some cyclic path starting from a state.

Parameters:
  • src (State) – the starting state
  • visited (set(str)) – set of names of already visited states
Returns:

whether there is some cyclic path starting from the input state
Return type:

bool
utils.generate_bad_twin(automaton, level=1)[source]¶

Generates the next level bad twin starting from the current level one.

Note that the 0-level bad twin is the input automaton.

Parameters:
  • automaton (Automaton) – the current level bad twin
  • level (int) – the next level of the bad twin to be generated
Returns:

the next level bad twin
Return type:

Automaton
utils.generate_good_twin(bad_twin)[source]¶

Generates the good twin starting from the bad twin.

Parameters:bad_twin (Automaton) – the bad twin
Returns:the good twin
Return type:Automaton
utils.initialize_states(automaton)[source]¶

Creates a name-state map of an automaton.

Parameters:automaton (Automaton) – the automaton
Returns:the name-state map the automaton
Return type:dict(str: State)
utils.synchronize_1(bad_twin, good_twin)[source]¶

Generates the synchronized automaton starting from the bad twin and the good twin.

It implements the first version of the synchronization method. It returns both the synchronized automaton and the set of representative ambiguous transitions. Each ambiguous transition is represented by a tuple in which the first element is the source state name and the second one is the destination state name.

Parameters:
  • bad_twin (Automaton) – the bad twin
  • good_twin (Automaton) – the good twin
Returns:

the synchronized automaton and the set of ambiguous transitions
Return type:

tuple(Automaton, set(tuple(str, str)))
utils.synchronize_2(old_synchronized, ambiguous_transitions, bad_twin, level)[source]¶

Generates the synchronized automaton starting from the previous level synchronized one.

It implements the second version of the synchronization method. It returns both the synchronized automaton and the set of representative ambiguous transitions. Each ambiguous transition is represented by a tuple in which the first element is the source state name and the second one is the destination state name.

Parameters:
  • old_synchronized (Automaton) – the previous level synchronized automaton
  • ambiguous_transitions (set(tuple(str, str))) – the set of ambiguous transitions to be updated
  • bad_twin (Automaton) – the current level bad twin
  • level (int) – the current level
Returns:

the synchronized automaton
Return type:

Automaton
